A business management graduate with significant experience in disability services, human resources and finance department; seeking to apply my abilities to position in a human resource department.
Proven ability to deal with multiple tasks efficiently and maintain organization.

<JD_START>
Job Title: Senior Accountant

Location: Kaysville, UT

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Accounting/Auditing, Finance

Description:
Want to learn more about this role and Jobot? Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!

Job details

This Jobot Job is hosted by Omar Benabicha

Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Easy Apply" button and sending us your resume.

Salary $90,000 - $100,000 per year

A Bit About Us

Our business has garnered a substantial customer base within the commercial construction sector. We are experts in providing cloud-based solutions designed to enhance the management of field employees and operations for contractors. Our platform is renowned for its robust integration capabilities with construction accounting software, making us a trusted partner for major software providers in the industry. This includes integration with well-known construction accounting systems.

Apply to learn more!



Why join us?


Great pay + benefits!

Inclusive work environment

Upward mobility

Job Details

Job Details

We seek a highly motivated, detail-oriented Senior Accountant to join our dynamic finance team. This is a full-time, permanent position that offers a unique opportunity to apply your financial acumen in a fast-paced, challenging and rewarding environment. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in maintaining our financial health and ensuring the smooth operation of our financial functions.

Responsibilities

As a Senior Accountant, your primary responsibilities will include

 Managing and overseeing all aspects of our accounting operations, including Accounts Payable, Accounts Receivable, and General Ledger. Preparing accurate and timely financial reports and statements, ensuring compliance with all applicable standards, regulations, and laws. Performing monthly, quarterly, and annual accounting activities, including reconciling bank and credit card accounts, coordinating and completing annual audits, and reviewing financial reports/support as necessary. Analyzing and reporting on financial status including income statement variances, communicating financial results to management, budget preparation and analysis. Streamline and improve financial systems and processes. Using Sage software to manage financial transactions and create financial reports. Assisting with tax audits and tax returns. Developing and documenting business processes and accounting policies to maintain and strengthen internal controls.

Qualifications

To be successful in this role, you will need

 A Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field. A minimum of 3 years of proven experience in a similar role. Strong proficiency in Sage and other financial management software. In-depth knowledge of financial regulations and accounting processes. Proven expertise in financial reporting and General Ledger functions. Excellent analytical skills with an attention to detail. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Ability to work independently, as well as part of a team. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically. Excellent time management skills, with the ability to prioritize and multitask.

Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Easy Apply" button.

Want to learn more about this role and Jobot?

Click our Jobot logo and follow our LinkedIn page!

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
